definitions.definition: To eat away bit by bit; to wear away or diminish by gradually separating or destroying small particles of, as by action of a strong acid or a caustic alkali .
To consume ; to wear away ; to prey upon; to impair .
examples: My morale is being corroded day by day.

definitions.definition: To have corrosive action; to be subject to corrosion .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To eat away bit by bit; to wear away or diminish by gradually separating or destroying small particles of, as by action of a strong acid or a caustic alkali .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To consume ; to wear away ; to prey upon; to impair .
( intransitive ) To have corrosive action; to be subject to corrosion .
